chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patricia L. Horton

records.addlTxt:
10:19 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Patricia L. Horton not in court. Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson in court for Patricia L. Horton. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Johnson advises the Court that the DE appeared earlier at her scheduled time, but due to a misunderstanding left because he went to another branch in the courthouse. Attorney Johnson is requesting a plea hearing as the matter is resolved and would request that no warrant be issued. State does not object. Court will not issue a warrant.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant, Patricia L. Horton, appeared with Attorney Seth Elijah Johnson.  Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  MR as allowed in CHIPs case.  *Not To Discuss Case w/ Kari H.

159PM  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.  Victim G.R.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on July 5, 2022 at 09:15 am. $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  Atty moves to strike portions of complaint language - court denies motion. sg
and witness list filed by the State
